file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-26-17-04 - LH FORWARD STOWAGE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL LH FORWARD STOWAGE - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the LH forward stowage. B. The LH forward stowage is installed in the passenger cabin, at zone 231. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AIRCRAFT WITH LH FORWARD STOWAGE 25-26-17-000-801-A LH FORWARD STOWAGE - REMOVAL OR POST-MOD SB 145-00-0036 AIRCRAFT WITH LH FORWARD STOWAGE LH FORWARD STOWAGE - INSTALLA- 25-26-17-400-801-A OR POST-MOD SB TION 145-00-0036 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 1 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-17-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH FORWARD STOWAGE OR POST-MOD SB 145-00-0036 2. LH FORWARD STOWAGE - REMOVAL A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to remove the LH forward stowage. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-27-05-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 26-24-01-000-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-29-01-000-801-A/400 GALLEY CONTROL MODULE - REMOVAL SRM 51-20-01 - TASK 25-21-04-000-802-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Gloves To prevent damage 4 available Commercially Shoe covers To prevent damage 4 available F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-003-A CAUTION: USE GLOVES AND SHOE COVERS TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE LH FORWARD STOWAGE AND CARPET. (1) Make sure that the aircraft is safe for maintenance. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 2 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Make sure that the LH forward stowage is empty. (3) On the air conditioning/pneumatic control panel, installed on the overhead panel, make sure that the PASS CABIN rotary switch is not set to the ATTD position and attach a DO-NOT-SET-TO-ATTD-POSITION tag to it. (4) On the overhead panel, set the EMERG LT switch to OFF position and attach a DO- NOT-MOVE-FROM-OFF tag to it. (5) On the circuit breaker panel, open the EMERG circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT- CLOSE tag to it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (6) On the LH power control and distribution box, open these circuit breakers and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to them: (a) CABIN LIGHT 1 ( Location Tip: RB DC BUS 1/LIGHTS/CABIN LIGHT 1). (b) CABIN LIGHT 4 ( Location Tip: RB DC BUS 1/LIGHTS/CABIN LIGHT 4). (c) CABIN LIGHT 1 ( Location Tip: RB GND SERVICE DC BUS 1/LIGHTS/CABIN LIGHT 1). (d) CABIN LIGHT 4 ( Location Tip: RB GND SERVICE DC BUS 1/LIGHTS/CABIN LIGHT 4). (7) Remove the main door curtain (AMM TASK 25-27-05-000-801-A/400). (8) Remove the forward cabin ceiling panel (TASK 25-21-04-000-802-A). (9) Remove the sealant from around of the LH forward stowage (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. J. LH Forward Stowage - Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-003-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH FORWARD STOWAGE OR POST-MOD SB 145-00-0036 (1) Open the door (3). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (2) Remove the first-aid-kit (2). (3) Remove the fire extinguisher (4) (AMM TASK 26-24-01-000-801-A/400). (4) Remove the portable oxygen cylinder (5). (5) Close the door (3). (6) Pull out the drawer (10) from the LH forward stowage (1) until it stops. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (7) Simultaneously, push the pins (11) and pull out the drawer (10). (8) Pull out the drawer (12) from the LH forward stowage (1) until it stops. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (9) Simultaneously, push the pins (13) and pull out the drawer (12). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 3 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (10) Open the slide door (21). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (11) Lift and push the slide door (21) into the LH forward stowage (1). (12) Remove the screws (18) and washers (17) that attach the grill (16). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (13) Remove the grill (16) to get access to the electronic equipment compartment (15). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (14) Remove the control modules (14) ( AMM TASK 33-29-01-000-801-A/400), if applicable. (15) Pull the slide door (21) forward and close it. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (16) Open the door (7). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (17) Remove the medical kit (6). (18) Remove the PBE (24). Refer to VIEW C, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (19) Remove the screws (33) and washers (32) that attach the PBE support (31). Refer to VIEW C, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (20) Remove the screws (30) that attach the cover (29). Refer to VIEW C, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (21) Remove the bolt (25) and washer (26) that attach the LH forward stowage (1) to the track engage fitting assembly (27) on the sidewall track (28). Refer to VIEW C, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (22) Remove the screws (39) that attach the cover (38). (23) Remove the bolt (43) and washer (42) that attach the LH forward stowage (1) to the track engage fitting assembly (41) on the sidewall track (40). Refer to VIEW E, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (24) Remove the screws (9) that attach the cover (8). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (25) Remove the bolts (34) and washers (35) that attach the floor fittings (37) of the LH forward stowage (1) to the floor track (36). CAUTION: THE STEP BELOW MUST BE DONE WITH EXTREME CARE TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE LH forward stowage (1) AND THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS. (26) Lightly move the LH forward stowage (1) to the aisle to get access to the electrical connectors (23). CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS ARE CORRECTLY IDENTIFIED. IF NOT, IDENTIFY THEM TO PREVENT A POSSIBLE INVERSION DURING THE INSTALLATION. INCORRECT CONNECTIONS CAN CAUSE MALFUNCTION OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT OR COMPONENT. (27) Disconnect the electrical connectors (23). Refer to DET. B, Figure 401, Sheet 2. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 4 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (28) Put protective caps on the disconnected electrical connectors (23). (29) Remove the LH forward stowage (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 5 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH FORWARD STOWAGE OR POST-MOD SB 145-00-0036 LH Forward Stowage - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 1 B 1. DRAWER 18. SCREW 9. SCREW 14. CONTROL MODULE D 17. WASHER 1 16. GRILL 15. ELETRONIC EQUIPMENT COMPARTMENT 11. PIN 12. DRAWER DET. A 13. PIN 1 145AMM251633.MCE SEALANT RTV 780 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 6 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH FORWARD STOWAGE OR POST-MOD SB 145-00-0036 LH Forward Stowage - Removal/Installation Figure 401 - Sheet 2 2 43. BOLT 42. WASHER 38. COVER 39. SCREW 22. CONTROL PANEL 41. TRACK ENGAGE 23. ELECTRICAL FITTING ASSEMBLY CONNECTOR 40. SIDEWALL TRACK VIEW E 2 34. BOLT 37. FLOOR FITTING VIEW B 35. WASHER 24. PBE 33. SCREW 2 36. FLOOR 25. BOLT TRACK 32. WASHER VIEW D (TYPICAL) 31. PBE SUPPORT 26. WASHER 27. TRACK ENGAGE FITTING ASSEMBLY 28. SIDEWALL TRACK 29. COVER VIEW C 2 30. SCREW 145AMM251634.MCE A TORQUE: 11.3 - 15.8 N.m.(100 - 140 lb.in.) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 7 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-26-17-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH FORWARD STOWAGE OR POST-MOD SB 145-00-0036 3. LH FORWARD STOWAGE - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This task gives the procedure to install the LH forward stowage. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-27-05-400-801-A/400 - AMM TASK 33-29-01-400-801-A/400 GALLEY CONTROL MODULE - INSTALLATION AIRSTAIRS MAIN DOOR WARNING MESSAGE - OP- AMM TASK 52-73-00-700-801-A/500 ERATIONALLY CHECK SRM 51-20-01 - TASK 25-21-04-400-802-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Gloves To prevent damage 4 available Commercially Shoe covers To prevent damage 4 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) RTV 780 (black) Sealant AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Passenger cabin 1 Helps the other technician Passenger cabin EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 8 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. LH Forward Stowage - Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-003-A EFFECTIVITY: AIRCRAFT WITH LH FORWARD STOWAGE OR POST-MOD SB 145-00-0036 CAUTION: USE GLOVES AND SHOE COVERS TO PREVENT DAMAGE TO THE LH FORWARD STOWAGE AND CARPET. (1) Remove the sealant residues from around of the LH forward stowage (1) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (2) Put the LH forward stowage (1) in position. (3) Remove the protective caps from the disconnected electrical connectors (23). Refer to VIEW B, Figure 401, Sheet 2. CAUTION: MAKE SURE THAT THE ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS ARE CORRECTLY IDENTIFIED. IF NOT, IDENTIFY THEM TO PREVENT A POSSIBLE INVERSION DURING THE INSTALLATION. INCORRECT CONNECTIONS CAN CAUSE MALFUNCTION OR DAMAGE TO THE EQUIPMENT OR COMPONENT. (4) Connect the electrical connectors (23). (5) Put the LH forward stowage (1) in its installation position. (6) Attach the LH forward stowage (1) to the track engage fitting assembly (41) on the sidewall track (40) with the bolts (43) and washers (42). Refer to VIEW E, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (7) Install the cover (38) with the screws (39). Refer to VIEW E, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (8) Open the door (7). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (9) Attach the LH forward stowage (1) to the track engage fitting assembly (27) on the sidewall track (28) with the bolts (25) and washers (26). Refer to VIEW C, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (10) Install the cover (29) with the screws (30). Refer to VIEW C, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (11) Attach the LH forward stowage (1) to the floor tracks (36) through the floor fittings (37) with the bolts (34) and washers (35). Refer to VIEW D, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (12) Install the cover (8) with the screws (9). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (13) Install the PBE support (31) with the screws (33) and washers (32). Refer to VIEW C, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (14) Install the PBE (24). Refer to VIEW C, Figure 401, Sheet 2. (15) Install the medical kit (6). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (16) Close the door (7). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (17) Open the slide door (21). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (18) Lift and push the slide door (21) into the LH forward stowage (1). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 9 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (19) Install the control modules (14) ( AMM TASK 33-29-01-400-801-A/400), if applicable. (20) Install the grill (16) with the screws (18) and washers (17) to close the access to the electronic equipment compartment (15). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (21) Pull the slide door (21) forward and close it. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (22) Return the drawers (10) and (12) to its original position. Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (23) Open the door (3). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (24) Install the portable oxygen cylinder (5). (25) Install the fire extinguisher (4) (TASK 26-24-01-400-801-A). (26) Install the first-aid-kit (2). (27) Close the door (3). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-003-A (1) Apply the sealant around of the LH forward stowage (1) (SRM 51-20-01). Refer to DET. A, Figure 401, Sheet 1. (2) On the overhead panel, remove the DO-NOT-SET-TO-ATTD-POSITION tag from the air conditioning/pneumatic control panel. (3) Close the EMERG circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it (Location Tip: ESSENTIAL DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/EMERG). (4) On the overhead panel, set the EMERG LT switch to ARM position and remove the DO-NOT-MOVE-FROM-OFF tag from it. (5) On the LH power control and distribution box, close these circuit breakers and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tags from them: (a) CABIN LIGHT 1 ( Location Tip: RB DC BUS 1/LIGHTS/CABIN LIGHT 1). (b) CABIN LIGHT 4 ( Location Tip: RB DC BUS 1/LIGHTS/CABIN LIGHT 4). (c) CABIN LIGHT 1 ( Location Tip: RB GND SERVICE DC BUS 1/LIGHTS/CABIN LIGHT 1). (d) CABIN LIGHT 4 ( Location Tip: RB GND SERVICE DC BUS 1/LIGHTS/CABIN LIGHT 4). (6) Install the forward cabin ceiling panel (TASK 25-21-04-400-802-A). (7) Install the main door curtain (AMM TASK 25-27-05-400-801-A/400). (8) Do an operational test of the main door internal control panel ( AMM TASK 52-73-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-2 25-26-17 Page 10 of 10 Rev 53 - Oct 31/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
